Replies.Reply: Ahh 3 years this August. If ya lookin for work you might wanna try Aberdeen, that's the closest mill work you're gonna find around here.
Nah just simple economics. Y'know we have a really nice casino here, the wild cherry. You wanna make some money maybe you wanna go on down there and try your luck at the blackjack tables.
Well hell, I know all about you Chris. I know your folks, I'm sheriff Stan Watkins.
Ralston get outta the car, you're lookin at a real soldier here pay some respect.
give ya a ride up to your folks.
Did I scare ya with that one?
You were gone a while huh?
Harstad, yeah. Sad story. About 5 months back he fell asleep at the wheel and uhhh... hit a tree. Good man, good man and a good sheriff.
I'm gonna need a statement from him Doctor.
I'll also need a copy of your write-up along with toxicoloy, blood alcohol level and so on.
I'm just tryin to get some facts here.
I'm just doing my job Michelle. Ok? I understand how you feel. But we still don't know yet who started all of this.
I'll do my best Mr Vaughn. I really will. In the meantime I have to file a full report. You lemme know when I can talk to him.
Well this isn't about that incident at the casino a while back is it?
They did an internal investigation. That's good enough for me.

Chris, I know you're familiar with the term 'no fly zone'. Hmm? Cause that's what the casino is. Since the mill closed down that casino is the main source of revenue in this town. So, case closed basically. I'll see ya.
Excuse me? What did you say to me?

You're lucky to be alive right now, that's all you need to be concentrating on. This is my town ok, I'm the sheriff here. I'll tell you what will stand, not the other way around. Now please get out of my building.
You should NOT have come looking for trouble. Keep your hands up, get out of the vehicle now Chris! NOW!
Nah I don't think so. Thanks.
8 years. Harstad was sheriff back then.
Your tent's gonna take on water. I could show ya how to rig it.
First of all I was a sergeant. I worked for a living.
I figured that'd be scrap metal by now dad.
No. Why dontcha crash on the floor?
Ok, I'll crash on the floor, you crash on the bed.
Still got a gut huh Jay?
I'm still all I can be.
I just wanna relax, catch my breath.
Alright boys, last play. We need to put this to rest.
You got it. On the first hut!
Hold up. Maybe next time I won't see you with the bleachers smoking weed.
Don't you have to be native american to own a casino?
Nobody's gonna have any problems finding this place.
Lil of both, I grew up here.
Bet you I'll roll a seven.
Put your bets down on the pass line. These dice are comin up seven.
No, we gonna let it ride Jimmy. The dice are comin up seven.
Why don't you just take care of that bet and we're even.
Yea, the problem is your dice are loaded. Does your boss know about this? Just gimme my money.
I was goin into town to get some supplies. Wanna come?
You gonna think I'm crazy. I been thinking about the mill. When I was a kid goin to visit you at work, the smell of that fresh-cut cedar. You remember that smell.
They miss a lot at your place don't they Jay.
What the fuck are you talking about?
I'm not gonna let this stand.
I said I'm not gonna let this stand.
I appreciate that, I thought this was history.
Can I talk to you outside for a second. Mom I'll be right back.
Well I went down to the police station and I talked to somebody with a badge. Sure as hell didn't seem like much of a sheriff.
Somebody ought to. How about you?
I like that. Jay Hamilton's done well for himself hasn't he.
Must be. I heard he got you.
You still work for him though.
No, that won't do any good.
But I'd have to plead guilty.
I wasn't wrong. And I won't say I was.
I don't deny anything that was said here today.
I'm not guilty of anything. Except standing up for myself when the law wouldn't.
I grew up in this town. People used to walk tall in this town, they wouldn't have traded the mill for a crooked casino.
happens to anyone again without punishing those who did it.
You. And the drugs you're pedalling out of your casino.
Yea that's right and I plan on taking care of everything else too.
Cause you owned the town Jay. It's changed now.
Sir get your tail lights fixed, it's your last warning.
I got a lil pull around here.
Are you done? Ray I need your help.
I need you to take me to drugs school.
You're SURE you're not carrying anything.
I'm gonna stay with him tonight. I need you to take care of my parent's place.
Don't you have to work tonight?
I gotta get a bigger bed.
Take that and get in there.
Come here.  They get down into the hole in the floor.
When I say 'now' start shooting, over there. Stay low.
What's it worth to you? Where's the lab?
Deni.... Deni.  Chris climbs out of the hole and they hug.
You're right Jay, this does change our relationship. This is my town, you're under arrest.
That oughta do it. WHAT are you doin?
Let's go pick my old man and grab somethin to eat.
Lil' brother.. You come over here and gimme a hug.
Hey, I couldn't let you be the only one looking good in uniform. Hey ma! Chris is here!
So what are you gonna do now that you're home?
Pete! This is your Uncle Chris.
Sit down, say hello. Last time he saw you you were barely walking.
I said you could sleep on the couch. It was Chris' room first.
Pete, cmon sit down, have somethin to eat.
What are you talkin about Stan?
How long do we have ya for?
I wish you would have told me you were coming I would've cooked.
We didn't wanna bother you with our problems when your father got laid off.
I substitute at the elementary school, Michelle pitches in. We try to keep things simple.
Deni? Nice to see you dear.
I got my business, you saw the furniture outside.
No, I'm still hoping that you'll melt that thing down on your own.
Just find out who did this to him Stan.
Changed the plugs a while back.
I might've had serious issues with your career choice but just didn't seem fair to take it out on an innocent truck. Where you headin?
Ya whole life, all you wanted to do was get outta here. What made you come back.
Mmm I remember a lotta nice things before the mill closed.
Closed about six months ago. There's a home depot about fifteen minutes up the road.
Aw Chris not like this. Chris listen to me. If you go outta here with that gun, they're gonna.. ne... Chris!
Why does it always have to be your fight?
No. I put my guns down a long time ago.
You and me both boy. Chris, listen. You be careful.
Doesn't look like it's gonna rain to me Colonel.
Y'know, Papa's still got your gun locked up in the garage. Think you could teach me how to shoot?
Hey Sarge, good game. Maybe next time.
There's some old crutches in the garage.
I'm sorry. I never did it before.
It's Pete. Want something to eat?

Nahh, look at me now though right? I been clean and sober for 14 months, doing construction and renewing those supportive and healthy friendships from my past. Matter of fact I talked to the bastards, told em you were back and they asked me to politely remind you that kick off's in twenty minutes.
If we score here we win right?
It's the subtle attention to aesthetics that I find most impressive, blends in with the mountains SO nicely.

Isn't it wonderful? All your gambling needs under one great big roof. You got your ATM machine, tellers to cash your paycheck, and when you're here you don't gotta worry about those lil things like child support, rent, the laws of mathematical probability.
Just remember, nothin in here's free. C'mon, this place is nothin but fake boobs and real assholes if ya ask me. Just water for me.
Thank you, they're for my best friend.
Hey sarge, so much for our VIP... status. Don't they teach you any fighting skills in the army.
Not good. But I tell you, that guy was feelin me this morning.
I don't know if you've noticed but this aint exactly home any more.
No, nope, no. Come on man you know I hate cops. You been sheriff 2 minutes and I'm already startin to hate you. I'm a convicted felon.
I get to wear a uniform?
Oh. Spread your legs, arms down. Been workin out? Nothin there. Ohhhh somebody needs a BATH!
He's clean. Guess we gotta move to plan B.
Please step away from the vehicle. Now Mr Booth are you still upset over that body cavity search? WOOOOOOOO! I forgot, you got no vehicle. Please disperse, there is nothing to s...
You think they're gonna take it that far?
I'm with you man, I'll check in later.
Gettin some souvenirs, I'm gonna miss the place!
Runnin the shower tower with the felons. He's probably blowin on somebody's dice right now.
His parents hadn't left him the mill more than 2 minutes before he shut it down.
We're gettin killed out here. I need you to put 200 down for the bet.
Yes, I'm in. Boom! Gimme some dice.
Chris, why don't we just let it go?
Come on, let's go! let's go!
Still got your reflexes. What, you get tired of being all that you can be?
Really? I'll just have to see about that. What brings you home?
See ya round. Hey, if you're not doing anythin later on you could come by the casino. I'll introduce ya to some nice girls, drinks are on me. Whaddya say?
Yeah well. Welcome to my world. Look tonight, all the drinks are on the house. If you need a line of credit, say how much. And if you need a lil female companionship...
Don't you worry about me, I've got a few things to do. Enjoy.
He's been fired, and his gaming permit's been pulled. I don't know how my security cameras didn't catch that.
Look Chris I hate seein ya like this.

Wait wait... so they got a little rough, they were a bit edgy. Understandably. You don't know what kind of assholes they have to put up with on a daily basis. Look, they've been reprimanded. They say you went nuts man. I'm sorry. I know the proper term vets use is post traumatic stress.

Whatever it was, you tore my place apart and it wasn't easy for me to get my guys agree not to press charges. Look Chris, if you had a problem... shouldn't you have come to me? Look, I wanna bring you inside. Chris I wanna make you head of security. Whaddya say?
Ah well. I guess you probably need time to think about it. This is for you. It's a little something to help you get... Y'know..
Come on man, don't be like that. I came all the way out here to your house just to see you get back on your feet.
I'm sorry you feel that way. I'll see ya round Chris.
Guess that changes our relationship a bit huh?
If you can, try to think this through. A casino is a license to print money. Why would I jeopardise that by selling drugs?

Really? See the only thing that I think has changed around here is that every morning you get to wake up and put on that nifty lil badge. But underneath that badge is the same guy that couldn't make it playing college football, apparently couldn't make it in the army and not gonna make it as a cop.
What's wrong with my tail lights?
Just a sec. Remember we used to play hide n seek up here?
You wanna know what my new favourite sound's gonna be? The sound of you screaming like a little bitch.
Just so you guys know, I'm gonna triple my money tonight.
Don't worry, everybody's a lil scared the first time. Get in there, sit back and enjoy.
If you're not back by morning we'll send a search party for you.
He had to walk!  They all laugh.
Don't say we never did nothin' for ya!
Gentlemen, Mr Hamilton would like to invite you to the VIP lounge.
He started bustin up the machines...
He went directly for everything. He just came in and took over the place.
Yea that's correct, my right forearm. Both bones with a single shot. It was crazy.
I was emptyin machines when Mr Vaugh came in and started swingin.
So you from here or just visiting.
So you've seen all the old faces.
Hey this is a clean game asshole.
It's not your roll sir. SIR! It's not your roll. Call security.
Folks, he's pretty banged up, inside and out. Whoever did this left him for dead. A lesser man wouldn't have survived.
He's in no condition to give you one.
Coulda left it in the trash but I...
Sunshine and pine trees. Been readin these books, teach you how to cultivate happiness. Books on the future, go with the flow, that sorta thing.
Yep. Been there almost a year.
Lot better than it treated you.
Yea, he's a real go-getter that one.
Lasted about 8 minutes, a long long time ago.
Hi. How's the food around here? Brought you special treats. Salmon, Fried Chicken, Potato Salad. You got cups?
Hmm I quit. I figured you know, you were making some changes around here, I could make a few myself.
Mm mmm, I want pancakes, and eggs, and bacon.
It's true. We mighta kinda pushed him into it.  Chris approaches the kid.
From the security guys workin at the casino.

I advise you to give this offer more than a little serious thought. If you go to trial you stand to do 18 years. This is a sweet plea, normally they wouldn't even put it on the table but your military record can't be ignored. Three months home arrest, some community service. Pretty generous offer Chris.
Look at it from the other side. There's over a dozen witnesses, none of em are gonna paint a very flattering picture.
Well I still say you should take it.
I was tryin to get outta there.

So dangerous, so violent, so highly trained that he despatched six of the casino staff single handedly. His weapon of choice a simple piece of cedar. Which in his hand became a devastating force with one aim, to hurt people, destroy property.
You said he broke your arm.
Did he give you any kind of advanced warning? A chance to defend yourself.
So from what you saw, it seemed like he had some kinda purpose?
You know, toss out a coupla drunks now and then. Guys try to grope the girls, but ah nothing with this sort of violence.
I think he had a point to prove yeah.
Mr Crow, you may present your client's case.
Order, order. Mr Vaughn, if you choose to represent yourself and not be represented by legal counsel you realise that you can't then claim a mistrial on that basis.
Does that mean you're changing your plea to guilty?
Sustained. Mr Vaughn stay on point.
Mr Vaughn we're not here to listen to civic speeches.
Order, order. Mr Vaughn you are now charged with contempt.
I order the jury to ignore what they have just seen. Mr Vaughn take your seat. Order! Order!
Mr Forman, has the jury reached a verdict?
Objection. He's trying to introduce prior events your honor.
We find the defendant Chris Vaughn not guilty.
Well you won the election, congratulations. We do have a tradition of professional courtesy up here, and I can personally vouch for each and every one of these men. They're good deputies.
Tried to warn ya Chris. Didn't want this to happen.
Now you read me my rights and take me in. And I call my lawyer.
WOOOOOOOOOOOO! I told you Vaughn! Uh ohhhh. Who needs to step away from the vehicle now Vaughn? Truck for truck baby, that's right, truck for a truck.
Vaughn you gotta get me outta here!
C'mon! Get me outta here man!
Ok! Ok! Hamilton's operation is at the mill ok! It's at the mill now get me outta here.
You stabbed me... with a potato peeler??
Gunman 2 looks away for a second and Michelle kicks him down the stairs. As he tumbles down Ray reloads his shotgun. The two begin firing at each other, taking cover behind the furniture.
